items.title: k-Uniform Ellipticity of the Regularized Metric
items.content:
653: :label: thm-ueph
654: 
655: For the Geometric Viscous Fluid Model with regularization parameter $\epsilon_\Sigma$ satisfying:
656: 
657: $$
658: \epsilon_\Sigma > H_{\max}(\rho)
659: 
660: $$
661: 
662: where $H_{\max}(\rho)$ is the **k-uniform** (and thus **N-uniform**) bound on $\|H(S)\|$ from Appendix A, Theorem {prf:ref}`thm-c2-regularity`, the regularized metric
663: 
664: $$
665: G_{\text{reg}}(S) = \left( H(S) + \epsilon_\Sigma I \right)^{-1}
666: 
667: $$
668: 
669: is uniformly elliptic with **k-uniform** (and thus **N-uniform**) ellipticity constants:
670: 
671: $$
672: c_{\min}(\rho) = \frac{1}{H_{\max}(\rho) + \epsilon_\Sigma}, \quad c_{\max}(\rho) = \frac{1}{\epsilon_\Sigma - H_{\max}(\rho)}
673: 
674: $$
675: 
676: such that:
677: 
678: $$
679: c_{\min}(\rho) I \preceq G_{\text{reg}}(S) \preceq c_{\max}(\rho) I
680: 
681: $$
682: 
683: for all $S \in \Sigma_N$, **all k** (alive walker counts), and **all N** (total swarm sizes).
684: 
685: Equivalently, the eigenvalues of $G_{\text{reg}}(S)$ satisfy:
686: 
687: $$
688: \lambda_i(G_{\text{reg}}(S)) \in [c_{\min}(\rho), c_{\max}(\rho)] \quad \forall i \in \{1, \ldots, d\}, \, \forall S \in \Sigma_N, \, \forall k, \, \forall N \in \mathbb{N}
689: 
690: $$
691:

items.label: thm-strat-chain
items.title: Stratonovich Chain Rule for Lyapunov Functions
items.content:
1244: :label: thm-strat-chain
1245: 
1246: Let $V: \Sigma_N \to \mathbb{R}$ be a $C^2$ function of the swarm state $S = \{(x_1, v_1), \ldots, (x_N, v_N)\}$, and suppose $S_t$ evolves according to the Stratonovich SDE:
1247: 
1248: $$
1249: \begin{aligned}
1250: dx_i &= v_i \, dt \\
1251: dv_i &= b_i(S) \, dt + \Sigma_{\text{reg}}(x_i, S) \circ dW_i
1252: \end{aligned}
1253: 
1254: $$
1255: 
1256: where $b_i(S)$ is the total drift (including all forces and friction).
1257: 
1258: Then the evolution of $V(S_t)$ is governed by:
1259: 
1260: $$
1261: dV = A(S_t) \, dt + B(S_t) \circ dW_t
1262: 
1263: $$
1264: 
1265: where the **Stratonovich drift** is:
1266: 
1267: $$
1268: A(S_t) = \sum_{i=1}^N \left[ \langle \nabla_{x_i} V, v_i \rangle + \langle \nabla_{v_i} V, b_i(S) \rangle \right] + \frac{1}{2} \sum_{i=1}^N \sum_{j=1}^d \left( \sigma_{ij} \cdot \nabla_{v_i} \right) \left( \sigma_{ij} \cdot \nabla_{v_i} V \right)
1269: 
1270: $$
1271: 
1272: where $\sigma_{ij}$ is the $j$-th column of $\Sigma_{\text{reg}}(x_i, S)$, and the operator $(\sigma_{ij} \cdot \nabla_{v_i})$ denotes the directional derivative in the direction $\sigma_{ij}$.
1273: 
1274: The stochastic term is:
1275: 
1276: $$
1277: B(S_t) \circ dW_t = \sum_{i=1}^N \sum_{j=1}^d \langle \nabla_{v_i} V, \sigma_{ij}(S) \rangle \circ dW_i^{(j)}
1278:

items.label: thm-fl-drift-adaptive
items.title: Foster-Lyapunov Drift for the ρ-Localized Geometric Viscous Fluid Model
items.content:
1691: :label: thm-fl-drift-adaptive
1692: 
1693: For the Geometric Viscous Fluid Model with localization scale ρ > 0, there exist **ρ-dependent critical parameters** $\epsilon_F^*(\rho) > 0$ and $\nu^*(\rho) > 0$ such that for all $0 \le \epsilon_F < \epsilon_F^*(\rho)$ and $0 \le \nu < \nu^*(\rho)$, the system satisfies a discrete-time Foster-Lyapunov drift condition:
1694: 
1695: $$
1696: \mathbb{E}[V_{\text{total}}(S_{k+1}) \mid S_k] \le (1 - \kappa_{\text{total}}(\rho)) V_{\text{total}}(S_k) + C_{\text{total}}(\rho)
1697: 
1698: $$
1699: 
1700: for all $k \ge 0$, where:
1701: 
1702: $$
1703: \kappa_{\text{total}}(\rho) = \kappa_{\text{backbone}} - \epsilon_F K_F(\rho) > 0
1704: 
1705: $$
1706: 
1707: $$
1708: C_{\text{total}}(\rho) = C_{\text{backbone}} + C_{\text{diff}}(\rho) + \epsilon_F K_F(\rho) < \infty
1709: 
1710: $$
1711: 
1712: **Critical Stability Threshold:**
1713: 
1714: $$
1715: \epsilon_F^*(\rho) := \frac{\kappa_{\text{backbone}} - C_{\text{diff,1}}(\rho)}{2 K_F(\rho)}
1716: 
1717: $$
1718: 
1719: where $C_{\text{diff,1}}(\rho)$ captures the ρ-dependent diffusion perturbation contribution to the drift coefficient.
1720: 
1721: **Interpretation:**
1722: - For any fixed ρ > 0, the critical threshold $\epsilon_F^*(\rho)$ is strictly positive
1723: - Smaller ρ (more local adaptation) → potentially larger $K_F(\rho)$ → smaller $\epsilon_F^*(\rho)$ → more restrictive stability condition
1724: - Larger ρ (more global statistics) → smaller $K_F(\rho)$ → larger $\epsilon_F^*(\rho)$ → as ρ → ∞, recovers the backbone threshold
1725: - The convergence rate $\kappa_{\text{total}}(\rho)$ depends on both εF and ρ, allowing tuning of the exploration-exploitation tradeoff

items.content:
2062: :label: thm-lsi-adaptive-gas
2063: 
2064: Let $\nu_N^{\text{QSD}}$ be the unique quasi-stationary distribution of the N-particle Geometric Viscous Fluid Model with parameters satisfying the conditions of Theorem [](#thm-fl-drift-adaptive) (sufficiently small $\epsilon_F$, arbitrary $\nu > 0$, and regularization $\epsilon_\Sigma > H_{\max}$).
2065: 
2066: There exists a constant $C_{\text{LSI}}(\rho) > 0$, **independent of the number of walkers $N$**, such that for every sufficiently smooth function $f$ on the N-particle state space:
2067: 
2068: $$
2069: \text{Ent}_{\nu_N^{\text{QSD}}}(f^2) \le C_{\text{LSI}}(\rho) \int \Gamma_N(f) \, d\nu_N^{\text{QSD}}
2070: 
2071: $$
2072: 
2073: The constant $C_{\text{LSI}}(\rho)$ depends only on:
2074: - The convexity constant $\kappa_{\text{conf}}$ of the confining potential (Axiom [](#ax:confining-potential-hybrid))
2075: - The uniform ellipticity bounds $c_{\min}(\rho)$ and $c_{\max}(\rho)$ from Theorem [](#thm-ueph) (N-uniform)
2076: - The localization radius $\rho$ and algorithm parameters $(\gamma, \epsilon_\Sigma, \epsilon_F)$
2077: 
2078: and **not** on $N$, the swarm state $S$, or the viscous coupling strength $\nu$ (which can be arbitrarily large).

items.title: Logarithmic Sobolev Inequality for the Mean-Field Generator
items.content:
2464: :label: thm-lsi-mean-field
2465: 
2466: For the mean-field limit of the Geometric Viscous Fluid Model (as $N \to \infty$), the mean-field generator $\mathcal{L}_{\text{MF}}$ satisfies a logarithmic Sobolev inequality with respect to its unique stationary state $\rho_{\text{QSD}}$. There exists a constant $\lambda_{\text{LSI}} > 0$ such that for all probability densities $f \in H^1_w(\mathcal{X} \times \mathbb{R}^d)$:
2467: 
2468: $$
2469: \text{Ent}_{\rho_{\text{QSD}}}(f) \le \frac{1}{2\lambda_{\text{LSI}}} D(f)
2470: 
2471: $$
2472: 
2473: where:
2474: - $\text{Ent}_{\rho}(f) := \int f \log(f / \rho) \, dx \, dv$ is the relative entropy.
2475: - $D(f) := -\int (\mathcal{L}_{\text{MF}} f) \log(f / \rho_{\text{QSD}}) \, dx \, dv$ is the entropy dissipation (Fisher information).

items.label: thm-c1-regularity
items.title: C¹ Regularity and k-Uniform Gradient Bound
items.content:
3274: :label: thm-c1-regularity
3275: 
3276: The ρ-localized fitness potential $V_{\text{fit}}[f_k, \rho](x_i) = g_A(Z_\rho[f_k, d, x_i])$ is C¹ in $x_i$ with gradient satisfying:
3277: 
3278: $$
3279: \|\nabla_{x_i} V_{\text{fit}}[f_k, \rho](x_i)\| \le F_{\text{adapt,max}}(\rho)
3280: 
3281: $$
3282: 
3283: where:
3284: 
3285: $$
3286: F_{\text{adapt,max}}(\rho) = L_{g_A} \cdot \left[ \frac{2d'_{\max}}{\sigma\'_{\min}} \left(1 + \frac{2d_{\max} C_{\nabla K}(\rho)}{\rho d'_{\max}}\right) + \frac{4d_{\max}^2 L_{\sigma\'_{\text{reg}}}}{\sigma'^2_{\min,\text{bound}}} \cdot C_{\mu,V}(\rho) \right]
3287: 
3288: $$
3289: 
3290: with the **N-uniform** bound on variance derivative:
3291: 
3292: $$
3293: C_{\mu,V}(\rho) = 2d'_{\max} \left(d_{\max} + d'_{\max}\right) + 4d_{\max}^2 \frac{C_{\nabla K}(\rho)}{\rho}
3294: 
3295: $$
3296: 
3297: **Proof:**
3298: 
3299: **Step 1: Chain Rule Decomposition.**
3300: 
3301: By the chain rule:
3302: 
3303: $$
3304: \nabla_{x_i} V_{\text{fit}}^{(i)} = g'_A(Z_\rho^{(i)}) \cdot \nabla_{x_i} Z_\rho^{(i)}
3305: 
3306: $$
3307: 
3308: **Step 2: Gradient of the Z-Score.**
3309: 
3310: The Z-score is $Z_\rho^{(i)} = (d(x_i) - \mu_\rho^{(i)}) / \sigma'_\rho^{(i)}$. By the quotient rule:
3311: 
3312: $$
3313: \nabla_{x_i} Z_\rho^{(i)} = \frac{1}{\sigma'_\rho^{(i)}} \left[ \nabla_{x_i} d(x_i) - \nabla_{x_i} \mu_\rho^{(i)} \right] - \frac{d(x_i) - \mu_\rho^{(i)}}{(\sigma'_\rho^{(i)})^2} \nabla_{x_i} \sigma'_\rho^{(i)}
3314: 
3315: $$
3316: 
3317: **Step 3: Gradient of the Regularized Standard Deviation.**
3318: 
3319: The regularized standard deviation is $\sigma'_\rho^{(i)} = \sigma\'_{\text{reg}}(V_\rho^{(i)})$. By the chain rule:
3320: 
3321: $$
3322: \nabla_{x_i} \sigma'_\rho^{(i)} = (\sigma\'_{\text{reg}})'(V_\rho^{(i)}) \cdot \nabla_{x_i} V_\rho^{(i)}
3323: 
3324: $$
3325: 
3326: where $|(\sigma\'_{\text{reg}})'(V)| \le L_{\sigma\'_{\text{reg}}}$ is the global Lipschitz constant from `01_fractal_gas_framework.md`.
3327: 
3328: **Step 4: k-Uniform Gradient of the Localized Variance.**
3329: 
3330: The variance is $V_\rho^{(i)} = \sum_{j \in A_k} w_{ij} d(x_j)^2 - (\mu_\rho^{(i)})^2$. Differentiating:
3331: 
3332: $$
3333: \nabla_{x_i} V_\rho^{(i)} = 2d(x_i) \nabla_{x_i} d(x_i) \cdot w_{ii} + \sum_{j \in A_k} d(x_j)^2 \nabla_{x_i} w_{ij} - 2\mu_\rho^{(i)} \nabla_{x_i} \mu_\rho^{(i)}
3334: 
3335: $$
3336: 
3337: Applying the **telescoping property** $\sum_{j \in A_k} \nabla w_{ij} = 0$:
3338: 
3339: $$

3274: :label: thm-c1-regularity
3275:

3277: 
3278: $$
3279: \|\nabla_{x_i} V_{\text{fit}}[f_k, \rho](x_i)\| \le F_{\text{adapt,max}}(\rho)
3280: 
3281: $$
3282: 
3283: where:
3284: 
3285: $$
3286: F_{\text{adapt,max}}(\rho) = L_{g_A} \cdot \left[ \frac{2d'_{\max}}{\sigma\'_{\min}} \left(1 + \frac{2d_{\max} C_{\nabla K}(\rho)}{\rho d'_{\max}}\right) + \frac{4d_{\max}^2 L_{\sigma\'_{\text{reg}}}}{\sigma'^2_{\min,\text{bound}}} \cdot C_{\mu,V}(\rho) \right]
3287: 
3288: $$
3289: 
3290: with the **N-uniform** bound on variance derivative:
3291: 
3292: $$
3293: C_{\mu,V}(\rho) = 2d'_{\max} \left(d_{\max} + d'_{\max}\right) + 4d_{\max}^2 \frac{C_{\nabla K}(\rho)}{\rho}
3294: 
3295: $$
3296: 
3297: **Proof:**
3298: 
3299: **Step 1: Chain Rule Decomposition.**
3300: 
3301: By the chain rule:
3302: 
3303: $$
3304: \nabla_{x_i} V_{\text{fit}}^{(i)} = g'_A(Z_\rho^{(i)}) \cdot \nabla_{x_i} Z_\rho^{(i)}
3305: 
3306: $$
3307: 
3308: **Step 2: Gradient of the Z-Score.**
3309: 
3310: The Z-score is $Z_\rho^{(i)} = (d(x_i) - \mu_\rho^{(i)}) / \sigma'_\rho^{(i)}$. By the quotient rule:
3311: 
3312: $$
3313: \nabla_{x_i} Z_\rho^{(i)} = \frac{1}{\sigma'_\rho^{(i)}} \left[ \nabla_{x_i} d(x_i) - \nabla_{x_i} \mu_\rho^{(i)} \right] - \frac{d(x_i) - \mu_\rho^{(i)}}{(\sigma'_\rho^{(i)})^2} \nabla_{x_i} \sigma'_\rho^{(i)}
3314: 
3315: $$
3316: 
3317: **Step 3: Gradient of the Regularized Standard Deviation.**
3318: 
3319: The regularized standard deviation is $\sigma'_\rho^{(i)} = \sigma\'_{\text{reg}}(V_\rho^{(i)})$. By the chain rule:
3320: 
3321: $$
3322: \nabla_{x_i} \sigma'_\rho^{(i)} = (\sigma\'_{\text{reg}})'(V_\rho^{(i)}) \cdot \nabla_{x_i} V_\rho^{(i)}
3323: 
3324: $$
3325: 
3326: where $|(\sigma\'_{\text{reg}})'(V)| \le L_{\sigma\'_{\text{reg}}}$ is the global Lipschitz constant from `01_fractal_gas_framework.md`.
3327: 
3328: **Step 4: k-Uniform Gradient of the Localized Variance.**
3329: 
3330: The variance is $V_\rho^{(i)} = \sum_{j \in A_k} w_{ij} d(x_j)^2 - (\mu_\rho^{(i)})^2$. Differentiating:
3331: 
3332: $$
3333: \nabla_{x_i} V_\rho^{(i)} = 2d(x_i) \nabla_{x_i} d(x_i) \cdot w_{ii} + \sum_{j \in A_k} d(x_j)^2 \nabla_{x_i} w_{ij} - 2\mu_\rho^{(i)} \nabla_{x_i} \mu_\rho^{(i)}
3334: 
3335: $$
3336: 
3337: Applying the **telescoping property** $\sum_{j \in A_k} \nabla w_{ij} = 0$:
3338: 
3339: $$
3340: \sum_{j \in A_k} d(x_j)^2 \nabla w_{ij} = \sum_{j \in A_k} [d(x_j)^2 - (\mu_\rho^{(i)})^2] \nabla w_{ij}
3341: 
3342: $$
3343: 
3344: For alive walkers in the ρ-neighborhood, $|d(x_j)| \le d_{\max}$, so $|d(x_j)^2 - (\mu_\rho^{(i)})^2| \le 2d_{\max}^2$. Using the **k-uniform bound** on $\|\nabla w_{ij}\|$ and only $k_{\text{eff}}(\rho) = O(1)$ contributing:
3345: 
3346: $$
3347: \left\|\sum_{j \in A_k} [d(x_j)^2 - (\mu_\rho^{(i)})^2] \nabla w_{ij}\right\| \le 2d_{\max}^2 \cdot \frac{2C_{\nabla K}(\rho)}{\rho} \cdot k_{\text{eff}} \le \frac{4d_{\max}^2 C_{\nabla K}(\rho)}{\rho}
3348: 
3349: $$
3350: 
3351: Similarly, using Lemma {prf:ref}`lem-mean-first-derivative`:
3352: 
3353: $$
3354: \|\nabla_{x_i} V_\rho^{(i)}\| \le 2d_{\max} d'_{\max} + \frac{4d_{\max}^2 C_{\nabla K}(\rho)}{\rho} + 2d_{\max} \left(d'_{\max} + \frac{4d_{\max} C_{\nabla K}}{\rho}\right) = C_{\mu,V}(\rho)
3355: 
3356: $$
3357: 
3358: which is **uniform in k** (and thus in N).
3359: 
3360: **Step 5: Combining the k-Uniform Bounds.**
3361: 
3362: Substituting back into Step 2 using the k-uniform bounds from Lemma {prf:ref}`lem-mean-first-derivative`:
3363: 
3364: $$
3365: \|\nabla_{x_i} Z_\rho^{(i)}\| \le \frac{1}{\sigma\'_{\min}} \left[ d'_{\max} + d'_{\max} + \frac{4d_{\max} C_{\nabla K}}{\rho} \right] + \frac{2d_{\max}}{\sigma'^2_{\min,\text{bound}}} L_{\sigma\'_{\text{reg}}} C_{\mu,V}(\rho)
3366: 
3367: $$
3368: 
3369: Finally, from Step 1:
3370: 
3371: $$
3372: \|\nabla_{x_i} V_{\text{fit}}^{(i)}\| \le L_{g_A} \cdot \|\nabla Z_\rho\|
3373: 
3374: $$

items.content:
3399: :label: thm-c2-regularity
3400: 
3401: The ρ-localized fitness potential $V_{\text{fit}}[f_k, \rho](x_i)$ is C² in $x_i$ with Hessian satisfying:
3402: 
3403: $$
3404: \|\nabla^2_{x_i} V_{\text{fit}}[f_k, \rho](x_i)\| \le H_{\max}(\rho)
3405: 
3406: $$
3407: 
3408: where $H_{\max}(\rho)$ is a **k-uniform** (and thus **N-uniform**) ρ-dependent constant given by:
3409: 
3410: $$
3411: H_{\max}(\rho) = L_{g''_A} \|\nabla Z_\rho\|^2_{\max}(\rho) + L_{g_A} \|\nabla^2 Z_\rho\|_{\max}(\rho)
3412: 
3413: $$
3414: 
3415: with:
3416: - $\|\nabla Z_\rho\|_{\max}(\rho) = F_{\text{adapt,max}}(\rho) / L_{g_A}$ from Theorem {prf:ref}`thm-c1-regularity` (k-uniform)
3417: - $\|\nabla^2 Z_\rho\|_{\max}(\rho)$ is the **k-uniform** bound on the Hessian of the Z-score (derived below)
3418: 
3419: **k-Uniform Explicit Bound:** For the Gaussian kernel with bounded measurements, using the **telescoping property** of normalized weights over alive walkers, $H_{\max}(\rho) = O(1/\rho^2)$ and is **independent of k** (and thus of N).
3420: 
3421: **Proof:**
3422: 
3423: **Step 1: Second Chain Rule Application.**
3424: 
3425: Differentiating $\nabla V_{\text{fit}} = g'_A(Z_\rho) \nabla Z_\rho$ using the product rule:
3426: 
3427: $$
3428: \nabla^2 V_{\text{fit}} = g''_A(Z_\rho) (\nabla Z_\rho) \otimes (\nabla Z_\rho) + g'_A(Z_\rho) \nabla^2 Z_\rho
3429: 
3430: $$
3431: 
3432: **Step 2: Hessian of the Z-Score (The Technical Core).**
3433: 
3434: This is the most technically demanding part. The Z-score is $Z_\rho = (d(x_i) - \mu_\rho) / \sigma'_\rho$. Differentiating the quotient rule expression from Theorem {prf:ref}`thm-c1-regularity`:
3435: 
3436: $$
3437: \begin{aligned}
3438: \nabla^2 Z_\rho &= \frac{1}{\sigma'_\rho} \left[ \nabla^2 d(x_i) - \nabla^2 \mu_\rho \right] \\
3439: &\quad - \frac{1}{(\sigma'_\rho)^2} \left[ (\nabla d - \nabla \mu_\rho) \otimes \nabla \sigma'_\rho + \nabla \sigma'_\rho \otimes (\nabla d - \nabla \mu_\rho) \right] \\
3440: &\quad - \frac{d(x_i) - \mu_\rho}{(\sigma'_\rho)^2} \nabla^2 \sigma'_\rho \\
3441: &\quad + \frac{2(d(x_i) - \mu_\rho)}{(\sigma'_\rho)^3} \nabla \sigma'_\rho \otimes \nabla \sigma'_\rho
3442: \end{aligned}
3443: 
3444: $$
3445: 
3446: **Step 3: Hessian of the Regularized Standard Deviation.**
3447: 
3448: $$
3449: \nabla^2 \sigma'_\rho = (\sigma\'_{\text{reg}})''(V_\rho) (\nabla V_\rho) \otimes (\nabla V_\rho) + (\sigma\'_{\text{reg}})'(V_\rho) \nabla^2 V_\rho
3450: 
3451: $$
3452: 
3453: where $|(\sigma\'_{\text{reg}})''(V)| \le L_{\sigma''_{\text{patch}}}$ (bounded by the properties of the cubic polynomial patch).
3454: 
3455: **Step 4: k-Uniform Hessian of the Localized Variance.**
3456: 
3457: Differentiating $\nabla V_\rho = 2d(x_i) \nabla d(x_i) w_{ii} + \sum_{j \in A_k} d(x_j)^2 \nabla w_{ij} - 2\mu_\rho \nabla \mu_\rho$:
3458: 
3459: $$
3460: \begin{aligned}
3461: \nabla^2 V_\rho &= 2(\nabla d) \otimes (\nabla d) w_{ii} + 2d(x_i) \nabla^2 d(x_i) w_{ii} + 4d(x_i) (\nabla d) \otimes (\nabla w_{ii}) \\
3462: &\quad + \sum_{j \in A_k} d(x_j)^2 \nabla^2 w_{ij} - 2(\nabla \mu_\rho) \otimes (\nabla \mu_\rho) - 2\mu_\rho \nabla^2 \mu_\rho
3463: \end{aligned}
3464: 
3465: $$
3466: 
3467: **Key k-Uniformity Step:** Apply the **telescoping property** $\sum_{j \in A_k} \nabla^2 w_{ij} = 0$ to the sum:
3468: 
3469: $$
3470: \sum_{j \in A_k} d(x_j)^2 \nabla^2 w_{ij} = \sum_{j \in A_k} [d(x_j)^2 - (\mu_\rho^{(i)})^2] \nabla^2 w_{ij}
3471: 
3472: $$
3473: 
3474: For alive walkers in the ρ-neighborhood, $|d(x_j)^2 - (\mu_\rho^{(i)})^2| \le 2d_{\max}^2$. Using $\|\nabla^2 w_{ij}\| \le C_w(\rho) = O(1/\rho^2)$ and only $k_{\text{eff}}(\rho) = O(1)$ alive walkers contributing:
3475: 
3476: $$
3477: \left\|\sum_{j \in A_k} [d(x_j)^2 - (\mu_\rho^{(i)})^2] \nabla^2 w_{ij}\right\| \le 2d_{\max}^2 \cdot C_w(\rho) \cdot k_{\text{eff}} = O\left(\frac{d_{\max}^2}{\rho^2}\right)
3478: 
3479: $$
3480: 
3481: Applying the **k-uniform bounds** from Lemmas {prf:ref}`lem-mean-first-derivative` and {prf:ref}`lem-mean-second-derivative`:
3482: 
3483: $$
3484: \|\nabla^2 V_\rho\| \le C_{\mu^2,V}(\rho) := 2d'^2_{\max} + 2d_{\max} d''_{\max} + \frac{8d_{\max} d'_{\max} C_{\nabla K}}{\rho} + \frac{2d^2_{\max} C_w(\rho)}{\rho^2} + C_{\text{product terms}}
3485: 
3486: $$
3487: 
3488: where $C_{\text{product terms}} = O(1/\rho)$ involves **k-uniform** products of $\nabla \mu_\rho$ and $\nabla^2 \mu_\rho$. The bound is **uniform in k** (and thus in N) with $C_{\mu^2,V}(\rho) = O(1/\rho^2)$.
3489: 
3490: **Step 5: Assembling the k-Uniform Bounds.**
3491: 
3492: Substituting the **k-uniform bounds** from Steps 3 and 4 into Step 2, and then into Step 1, yields:
3493: 
3494: $$
3495: \|\nabla^2 V_{\text{fit}}\| \le L_{g''_A} \|\nabla Z_\rho\|^2 + L_{g_A} \|\nabla^2 Z_\rho\|
3496: 
3497: $$
3498: 
3499: Using the k-uniform bounds on $\nabla Z_\rho$ (Theorem {prf:ref}`thm-c1-regularity`) and the analysis above showing $\|\nabla^2 Z_\rho\| = O(1/\rho^2)$ uniformly in k and N:
3500: 
3501: $$
3502: H_{\max}(\rho) \le C_H \left( \frac{1}{\sigma'^2_{\min} \rho^2} + \frac{1}{\sigma'_{\min} \rho^2} \right) = O\left(\frac{1}{\rho^2}\right)
3503: 
3504: $$
